intro: Leucopogon allittii, commonly known as the slender heath, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Leucopogon allittii is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and is often found in coastal scrub and dune environments.
